page.title: 20A CHILD'S WRITING age 10yrs.
page.content: {FROM SCHOOL FIELD AT SOUTH KILWORTH. To the left of me is the lush green grass . Smalland proud the diasy stands,her small white feathers coat round her head and her green stalk stands tall. Directley in front of me lies the football pitch,flowers blooming all over.The ball lies paralysed in the grass with little black flies on it.To my side a little bee is crawling around on the inside of a flower sucking yellow from it's bright centre,then it's work is done and it flies away into the blue sky. The sweet sounds of birds reach me the mooing of cows,the calling of the lambs.The bees buzz,their endless conversation calling to the bright flowers.An old blue truck lies motionless by the road casting a deep shadow.A perfect part of nature is the small butterfly sailing past.
